description.narrative: Key social protection programmes have strengthened operational capacity and are supported to improve coverage

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Support to other social protection programs - Universal health coverage/health insurance
Support to other social protection programs: Child care and early childhood development

title.narrative: Ghana United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ghana Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Policy and Social Protection)
UNICEF Programmes in Ghana (Social Policy and Protection)
Ghana Country Programme Document 2012-2016 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key social protection programmes have strengthened operational capacity and are supported to improve coverage

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to provide high quality technical inputs to support LEAP to strengthen its management systems, standardize operations, and test systems innovations. Continued high level and technical advocacy to protect programme integrity, including re-assessment process and regularity of payments. New partnership developing with NHIS to increase coverage of most vulnerable. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/01/2020

title.narrative: 2.10 Cash transfers: Cash transfer system is being effectively IMPLEMENTED including the expanding coverage and improving inclususion of children (e.g. beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms).

actual.value: 2020:Communication modalities and approaches have been designed and agreed with Government

title.narrative: 2.10 Cash transfers: Cash transfer system is being effectively IMPLEMENTED including the expanding coverage and improving inclususion of children (e.g. beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms).
2.7 Data management: Social protection data management system developed (management information systems, social and beneficiary registries, M and E systems)

baseline.value: centralized LEAP MIS avail at national level

actual.value: 2020:Software was developed and has been tested in 2019. Roll-out for 70 additional districts is underway in Q1 2020

title.narrative: 2.7 Data management: Social protection data management system developed (management information systems, social and beneficiary registries, M and E systems)

baseline.value: centralized LEAP MIS avail at national level

actual.value: 2020:Software was developed and has been tested in 30 districts 2019
